oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1943-04-17 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from April 17, 1943. Featuring Louie Buck (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Bashful Brother Oswald, Rachel Veach, Zeke Clements, Minnie Pearl, Pap's Jug Band, and Mac McGar. Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Pap's Jug Band; Bashful Brother Oswald; Rachel Veach; Mac McGar; Roy Acuff
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: George D. Hay introduces Trudy Brown -- Trudy Brown interviews service men -- Louie Buck talks -- George D. Hay introduces Pap's Jug Band -- Crawdad Song (Pap's Jug Band) -- Prince Albert commercial (Louie Buck, George D. Hay) -- George D. Hay introduces Rachel Veach and Bashful Brother Oswald -- Weary Blues (Rachel Veach, Bashful Brother Oswald) -- George D. Hay introduces Mac McGar -- Fire On The Mountain (Mac McGar) -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff -- Ida Red (Roy Acuff) -- Closing statement (George D. Hay, Bashful Brother Oswald)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Bashful Brother Oswald; Veach, Rachel; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Pap's Jug Band; Wilson, Lonnie; Minnie Pearl; McGar, Mac; Clements, Zeke
